title: ROOT Sports and Willow by Cricbuzz Team Up to Air Seattle Orcas’ MLC Matches
body:
Story Highlights

Willow by Cricbuzz, offering more live, streaming and on-demand cricket than any other sports service, announces a strategic partnership with ROOT SPORTS, the television home of the Seattle Mariners, Portland Trail Blazers, Seattle Seahawks, Seattle Seawolves, and Gonzaga Bulldogs. Under this agreement, ROOT SPORTS will broadcast Major League Cricket (MLC) matches live, delivering high-octane cricket action to fans across the Pacific Northwest.

Starting July 5, 2024, cricket enthusiasts in the Pacific Northwest can tune into live broadcasts of electrifying MLC matches on ROOT SPORTS, the network delivering more than 330 live events each year across a five-state footprint that includes Washington, Oregon, Montana, Idaho, and Alaska. After a tremendous showing of support and engagement nationwide during the ICC T20 World Cup, this partnership will increase accessibility to the sport in the Pacific Northwest and help grow the game in America in unprecedented ways.

“ROOT SPORTS is an ideal partner to bring the exhilarating action of Major League Cricket to the Pacific Northwest,” says Todd Myers, COO of Willow by Cricbuzz. “The T20 World Cup sparked a tremendous surge in cricket enthusiasm across the nation, and through this partnership, we aim to harness that excitement to engage existing fans and create new ones. By providing unprecedented access to live cricket and bringing fans closer to the heart of the game, we look forward to making cricket a central part of the sports experience in the Pacific Northwest and inspiring a broader appreciation for the game.”

Willow by Cricbuzz will distribute all MLC matches this season on TV and its dedicated streaming app.

body:
Here are the Fantasy Cricket Predictions and Betting Tips for the Major League Cricket Match 10- LA Knight Riders vs San Francisco Unicorns, which will be played on the 13th of July at the Church Street Park, Morrisville.

Points Table

Current Form LA Knight Riders:

LA Knight Riders are currently placed at the 4th position on points table with 1 win and 2 losses to their credit.

The top run scorer for LA Knight Riders in the Major League Cricket is Jason Roy with 97 runs to his name.

The top wicket taker for LA Knight Riders in the Major League Cricket is Spencer Johnson with 6 scalps under his belt.

LA Knight Riders have lost their previous match against Seattle Orcas by a big margin of 9 wickets.

LA Knight Riders batted first and they posted a total of 168 for 5 in 20 overs. Sunil Narine, Unmukt Chand and Shakib Al Hasan got out cheaply. Jason Roy and David Miller played with a lot of heart and smashed 69 and 44 runs respectively to help LA Knight Riders get to a competitive total of 168 in 20 overs of play.

During the chase, Nauman Anwar got out cheaply. After his dismissal, Ryan Rickelton and Quinton de Kock then played with a lot of courage and intent. Rickelton scored a century and made 103 runs off 66 balls while De Kock scored 51 runs to win the match for Seattle Orcas with 9 wickets in hand.

San Francisco Unicorns have lost their previous match against Texas Super Kings by 7 wickets.

San Francisco Unicorns batted first and they posted a total of 127 before being bowled out. title: Washington Freedom Edges Over Seattle Orcas by 5
body:
Ferguson and Netravalkar starred with the ball, while Milantha and Pineaar played a crucial part with the bat in Washington’s win.

Dallas, Texas (July 12,2024)- Washington Freedom edged out Seattle Orcas by 5 wickets in a low-score match in the Cognizant Major League Cricket at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas on Thursday.

Lockie Furgueson (4/26) and Saurabh Netravalkar (3/18) took seven wickets in shred way to clear out Seattle Orcas on 124 in 19.4 overs. Lahiru Milantha (33* off 30) and Obus Pineaar (31* off 30) then made a crucial partnership of 63 runs to guide Washington Freedom across their 125 run target with 10 balls to spare.

With this victory, Washington Freedom moved to the top of the table with 5 points from three matches, standing as the only unbeaten team in the tournament thus far.

Seattle Orcas came out blazing to defend a low total of 125 runs. Imad Wasim dismissed Travis Head for a duck on the second ball of the innings, ending his over with a wicket and a maiden. Steve Smith and Rachin Ravindra then tried to rebuild the score with a counter attack, and they scored as many as 18 runs in the 3rd over. Ravindra was looking dangerous with his bat, but Nandre Burger dismissed him in the fifth over for 26 off 16 balls. Smith followed him back to pavilion in the over that followed with 12 off 13, leaving the Orcas at 47/3 after 6 overs.

Both Mukhtar Ahmed and Glenn Maxwell were given lifelines as both of their catches were dropped once, but they couldn’t make use of their second chances. Ahmed(8 off 8) was dismissed by Burger in 8th over, and Maxwell(10 off 11) fell to Harmeet, leaving their team struggling at 68/5 after 10 overs.

Despite the situation, Washington Freedom batters showed their agility as they carefully approached their target.

Earlier in the contest, Seattle Orcas had a slow start to their innings. The Seattle batters struggled to accelerate on the slow batting track, only getting 35 runs in the powerplay.

Heinrich Klaasen and Shubham Ranjane carefully made a crucial partnership that somewhat steadied Seattle’s innings. They crossed 100-run mark in the 15th over.

Meanwhile, Washington bowlers didn’t allow the batters to score big. Ferguson took 2 wickets in the 27th over, finishing his spell with 4 wickets, leaving Seattle struggling at 112/8 after 18 overs.

Seattle managed to get 9 runs in penultimate over. Cameron Gannon struck a six, but was dismissed on his second attempt as Ferguson caught him out. Netravakar then removed Nandre Burger, thus bowling out Orcas at 124 in 19.4 overs.

title: MLC 2024: Washington Freedom Edge Seattle Orcas by 5 Wickets in a Low-Scoring Thriller
body:
oi-Avinash Sharma

Dallas(TX), Jul 12: Washington Freedom clinched a nail-biting victory over the Seattle Orcas by five wickets in a low-scoring encounter of the Major League Cricket 2024 at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas, on Thursday (July 11).

Lockie Ferguson (4/26) and Saurabh Netravalkar (3/18) were the standout bowlers, sharing seven wickets to restrict the Seattle Orcas to 124 in 19.4 overs. Lahiru Milantha (33* off 30) and Obus Pienaar (31* off 30) then anchored a crucial unbeaten 63-run partnership to guide Washington Freedom past their 125-run target with 10 balls to spare.

With this win, Washington Freedom moved to the top of the points table with five points from three matches, remaining the only unbeaten team in the tournament thus far.

Seattle Orcas Innings:

Seattle Orcas struggled from the start, with Nauman Anwar falling cheaply for 3 off 9 balls to Saurabh Netravalkar in the second over. The batters found it difficult to accelerate on a slow batting track, managing only 35 runs in the Powerplay. Ryan Rickelton was dismissed for 4 off 11 balls by Lockie Ferguson in the sixth over.

Quinton de Kock (24 off 19) started well but was bowled by Ferguson in the eighth over, leaving Seattle at 44/3. Heinrich Klaasen (51 off 29) tried to stabilize the innings with a half-century but was caught by Mukhtar Ahmed at long-off off Marco Jansen in the 15th over. Despite Klaasen's efforts, the rest of the batting lineup faltered, with Ferguson and Netravalkar dismantling the lower order.

Seattle Orcas were eventually bowled out for 124 in 19.4 overs, with Cameron Gannon's brief attempt to add runs falling short as he was dismissed for 8 off 5 balls.

Washington Freedom Innings

Chasing a modest total, Washington Freedom faced early setbacks. Imad Wasim removed Travis Head for a duck on the second ball, finishing the over with a wicket maiden. Steve Smith and Rachin Ravindra tried to rebuild with an aggressive approach, but Ravindra was dismissed by Nandre Burger for 26 off 16 balls in the fifth over, and Smith followed shortly after for 12 off 13 balls.

Mukhtar Ahmed and Glenn Maxwell were both given lifelines with dropped catches but couldn't capitalize. Ahmed fell for 8 off 8 balls, and Maxwell was dismissed for 10 off 11 balls, leaving Washington at 68/5 after 10 overs.

However, Milantha and Pienaar displayed resilience, carefully steering the innings towards the target. They brought Washington Freedom to the 100-run mark in the 16th over, eventually surpassing the target with an unbeaten 63-run partnership, ensuring a win with 10 balls remaining.

MLC 2024 Points Table Status after Washington Freedom win

With this victory, Washington Freedom climbed to the top of the points table, maintaining their unbeaten streak with five points from three matches.

Brief Scores:

Seattle Orcas: 124 all out in 19.4 overs (Heinrich Klaasen 51, Quinton de Kock 24; Lockie Ferguson 4/26)

Washington Freedom: 125/5 in 18.2 overs (Lahiru Milantha 33*, Obus Pienaar 31*; Nandre Burger 2/27).

title: NY vs TEX Dream11 Prediction, Dream11 Playing XI, Today Match 9, MLC 2024
body:

The next game of the ongoing Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 will be played between MI New York and Texas Super Kings. This is the ninth clash of the tournament, which will take place at the Church Street Park in Morrisville. Both teams are sitting side by side on the points table.

The Super Kings are second on the table with three points. They will eye a win here, because that can help them move to the No. 1 position on the table. On the other hand, NY are at third place with two points, but they have the best NRR. These two points will be very crucial for them.

Match Date: July 12, 2024 (Friday)

Time: 12:30 AM (Jul 13) / 07:00 PM GMT / 03:00 PM LOCAL

Venue: Church Street Park, Morrisville

NY vs TEX: Head-to-Head: NY (1) – TEX (1)

These two teams have played two matches so far, and both came in the first season. Both sides have won one game each.

NY vs TEX: Weather Report

There is prediction of thundershowers on Friday afternoon in Morrisville, so we can only hope for a complete game. The predicted temperature will be around 28° C with a wind speed of 10 km/h and humidity level of 79 percent.

NY vs TEX: Pitch Report

This venue is good for bowling, as there are some lateral moment initially for the fast bowlers. If it rains, the outfield will slow down and the ball will seam more, which can create problem for the batters even more. Hence, it will be good to win the toss and bowl first.

title: opener ruben clinton Cricket News
body:
MI New York: In a rain-marred third match of the ongoing Major League Cricket 2024 at the Church Street Park in Morrisville, Washington Freedom prevailed over MI New York by four runs via the DLS Method.

The match was a tightly contested one. In the second innings, Washington Freedom faced an early setback with the dismissal of Travis Head (1). Steve Smith initially took a couple of overs to settle in, but once he found his rhythm and struck his first boundary on his seventh ball, the New York bowlers struggled to contain him. The Australian star batter smashed four fours and three sixes, racing to an impressive 46* off 28 balls.

With 7.4 overs of the Washington Freedom innings done, the match took a turn for the worse as rain and lighting brought on the covers. However, Smith’s power-hitting in the final over of the powerplay took them ahead on DLS with a score of 55/1. In the end, that proved enough to seal the match as rain played spoilsport.

title: Both mukhtar ahmed Cricket News
body:
Major League Cricket: Washington Freedom edged out Seattle Orcas by five wickets in a tense low-scoring match of the 2024 Major League Cricket at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas on Thursday.

Lockie Ferguson (4/26) and Saurabh Netravalkar (3/18) shared seven wickets between them to bundle out Seattle Orcas to 124 in 19.4 overs. Lahiru Milantha (33* off 30) and Obus Pienaar (31* off 30) then anchored a crucial unbeaten 63-run partnership to guide Washington Freedom past their 125-run target with 10 balls to spare.

With this win, Washington Freedom moved to the top of the points table with five points from three matches, remaining the only unbeaten team in the tournament thus far.

title: MINY vs TSK Match Prediction Who Will Win Today’s Match 9 Major League Cricket 2024
body:

Match Preview

In the third match of the Major League Cricket series, MI New York batted first and set a target of 154/9 in their allotted 20 overs. Nicholas Pooran, showcasing his skill behind the stumps and with the bat, contributed a solid 44 runs off 30 balls. Rashid Khan added a quickfire 31 runs from just 15 deliveries, injecting momentum into the innings. Ruben Clinton played a steady hand with 28 runs off 22 balls, consolidating the middle order.

On the bowling front, Ehsan Adil bowled economically, conceding just 14 runs and taking a crucial wicket in his 2 overs. Trent Boult proved equally effective, restricting the scoring with an impressive spell that yielded only 3 runs in his 2 overs. Nosthush Kenjige maintained tight control, giving away a mere 3 runs in his 0.4 overs, adding pressure on the opposition.

In Match 7, the San Francisco Unicorns faced the Texas Super Kings and posted a total of 127 all out in 17.5 overs. In response, the Texas Super Kings chased down the target comfortably, reaching 128/3 in just 12.5 overs. Captain Faf du Plessis led from the front with a brisk 34 runs off 17 balls, setting the tone early in the innings. Aaron Hardie matched his captain’s tempo, contributing an identical 34 runs off 23 deliveries, ensuring a steady flow of runs.

Devon Conway, displaying his prowess behind the stumps and with the bat, played a pivotal role with 32 runs from 19 balls, guiding the innings towards victory. Mohammad Mohsin starred with the ball for the Texas Super Kings, dismantling the opposition with an impressive haul of 4 wickets for just 13 runs in 3.5 overs. Dwayne Bravo supported him well, claiming 2 wickets for 20 runs in his 3 overs. Zia-ul-Haq also contributed with 2 wickets, although conceding 41 runs in his 3 overs.

Both matches showcased thrilling performances, with MI New York and Texas Super Kings displaying their prowess in batting and bowling respectively, setting the stage for an exciting season ahead in Major League Cricket.

title: WATCH: Cameron Gannon cleans up Steve Smith during SO vs WF game in MLC 2024
body:
In a gripping encounter of the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024, the Seattle Orcas faced off against the Washington Freedom at a packed stadium. Washington Freedom emerged victorious, chasing down a target set by the Orcas with five wickets in hand.

Steve Smith looks visibly upset on his dismissal

The match witnessed a standout moment when Cameron Gannon, bowling for the Seattle Orcas, delivered a stunning blow to dismiss the renowned Steve Smith of Washington Freedom. Gannon’s delivery, clocking in at 135 kmph, landed on a perfect length angled towards the off-stump. Smith, known for his aggressive stroke play, charged down the pitch aiming to drive through the off-side.

However, Gannon’s deceptive movement caught Smith off-guard. The ball nipped back slightly, kissing the under edge of Smith’s bat before dislodging the off bail. The dismissal left Smith visibly frustrated as he departed the crease after contributing just 12 runs to his team’s chase.

Here is the video:

Also WATCH: Mitchell Santner hits a mammoth 106-metre six during SFU vs TSK match in MLC 2024

Washington Freedom gets the better of Seattle Orcas

Seattle Orcas, after being put into bat, struggled to build partnerships against a disciplined bowling attack from Washington Freedom. They managed to post a total of 124 all out in 19.4 overs, with Heinrich Klaasen‘s brisk 51 off 30 deliveries being the highlight of their innings. Lockie Ferguson was the chief tormentor for Washington Freedom, claiming impressive figures of 4/26, while Saurabh Netravalkar supported well with 3/18.

In response, Washington Freedom achieved the target comfortably in 18.2 overs, reaching 127/5. Lahiru Milantha anchored the innings with an unbeaten 33, supported by Obus Pienaar‘s crucial 31 not out. Their partnership ensured that Washington Freedom crossed the finish line without much trouble, securing a significant victory in the MLC 2024 season.

The match showcased thrilling moments of skill and strategy, reaffirming the competitive spirit of the exciting tournament. With more exciting clashes scheduled ahead, fans can expect further exhilarating action in the ongoing tournament.

title: WATCH: 6,4,6- Rachin Ravindra turns the tide with explosive batting against Imad Wasim in MLC 2024
body:
In a thrilling encounter at the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024, Washington Freedom emerged victorious against Seattle Orcas, thanks to an outstanding performance by Rachin Ravindra. The match held at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas saw Washington Freedom successfully chase down Seattle Orcas’s target of 125 runs in the first inning.

Rachin Ravindra’s spectacular onslaught against Imad Wasim

Seattle Orcas, batting first, scored 124 runs before being bowled out. This set Washington Freedom’s target of 125 runs to achieve victory. Chasing the set total, the Washington side faced an early setback as Travis Head was dismissed in the very first over, leaving them at 6/1.

However, Ravindra’s entry into the game proved to be a turning point. Coming in to bat, Ravindra faced Wasim in the third over of the 2nd innings.

Ravindra hammered 17 runs off Wasim in a single over, comprising two sixes and a four. This onslaught boosted Washington Freedom’s run rate and rattled the opposition. Wasim, who had earlier taken the wicket of Head in his first spell, struggled against Ravindra’s aggressive batting. Despite finishing his 4-over spell with a total of 31 runs, Wasim’s over to Ravindra stood out for its impact on the match.

Here is the video:

Also WATCH: Cameron Gannon cleans up Steve Smith during SO vs WF game in MLC 2024

Rachin Ravindra’s dominance secures Washington Freedom’s convincing victory

Ravindra’s innings was pivotal as he went on to score 26 runs off just 16 balls at a striking rate of 162.50, including three fours and two sixes. Both of his sixes came off Wasim’s bowling in that memorable over, showcasing his dominance over the experienced bowler. In the end, Washington Freedom comfortably reached the finish line in the 19th over , finishing with a score of 127 for the loss of 5 wickets. This comprehensive victory underscored Washington Freedom’s dominance and resilience throughout the match.
